 Define the cross product of three classes.  Compare ~ df-xp . (Contributed by FL, 6-Nov-2013.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2015.)
statement:
dfxp3 $p |- ( ( A X. B ) X. C ) = { <. <. x , y >. , z >. | ( x e. A /\ y e. B /\ z e. C ) } $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d C x y z $.
